title: It's All About Perspective
description:
————————————————————
Ready to build a network of amazing women and high-status men?

Michael’s Men of Action is a one-on-one Master’s program that teaches men how to create elite 
social lives by becoming higher status.

Click this link to learn how you can have a High-Status lifestyle now:
https://m.moamentoring.com/podcast

Click here to join the Men of Action community and watch the High-Status Networking 101 course:
https://m.moamentoring.com/moa-community

Interested in joining the Men of Action sales team? Apply here:
https://www.moamentoring.com/jobs/sales

Men of Action has an affiliate program! Post pre-made content and get paid passively:
https://www.moamentoring.com/affiliate
————————————————————

Subscribe on Youtube: 
https://www.youtube.com/user/MichaelSartain

Listen on Apple Podcast: 
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-michael-sartain-podcast/id1579791157

Listen on Spotify: 
https://open.spotify.com/show/2faAYwvDD9Bvkpwv6umlPO?si=8Q3ak9HnSlKjuChsTXr6YQ&dl_branch=1

#michael #michaelsartain #michael_sartain #michael_sartain_podcast

channel_info.title: Michael Sartain
channel_info.description:
🎙Host of The Michael Sartain Podcast 

🔥Teaching you how to build a network of desirable women and high-status men

👇 Click the "Men of Action" link below now to forge a high-status lifestyle and join the elites

transcription: {"text": "I was on the bus and I was about 13 years old and there was a girl to the left of me and she was making fun of everyone and she looked at me and looked me in my eyes and was like, I don't even have to start with you, you're already too messed up anyway, look at you. And a few things go on. So one thing that goes on in the brain is you start to stack. So we can stack thoughts in a negative way and we can stack thoughts in a positive way. So for example, if you ever woken up on the wrong side of the bed, if you don't catch your focus, your whole f***ing day is negative. Tire pressure's off, I gotta go to work, Betty at the work, you know, all of it, just stack and stack and stack. And so I started to stack thoughts when that girl said that to me and the thoughts were, well, maybe she's right, maybe I'm disgusting. Now that I look at it as an adult, I wish I could go back and I can hug her and love on that little girl. You see, you have compassion now, you understand what she was going through. What is that little girl going through at home and with her own s*** that she had to take it out on me, a man with no legs and arms, she must have been going through some s*** and she just had to take it out on me. And so now as an adult and with perspective, I have compassion and empathy for her, but back then I didn't have that.
